_source.contentraw:
Still, not everyone is sold on FRT. For example, the cities of Oakland, Portland, San Francisco, and Seattle have imposed blanket bans on the technology, prohibiting its use by any government agency within their jurisdictions. Several state legislatures are also conducting official investigations into FRT, and the nefarious purposes to which the data it collects and stores are put. At the start of 2021, New Jersey’s attorney general put a moratorium on Clearview’s use by police and announced an investigation into “this product or products like it.”

Similarly, at the start of February, the Internal Revenue Service caved to enormous public pressure and cancelled plans to use facial recognition to confirm the identities of Americans using its website to pay taxes or access documents.

By contrast, New York Mayor Eric Adams has forcefully asserted his determined commitment to even further expanding the city’s FRT capabilities on numerous occasions since winning office in November 2021. In late January at a press conference announcing the release of a “blueprint to end gun violence,” he pledged to “move forward on using the latest in technology to identify problems, follow up on leads and collect evidence.”

_source.content: CNN UNINTENTIONALLY CONFIRMS MAJOR RUSSIAN ACCUSATION AGAINST ZELENSKY.Written by Eric ZuesseL'une des principales accusations du gouvernement russe à l'encontre du gouvernement du président ukrainien Volodmyr Zelensky est que les forces de Zelensky utilisent les civils ukrainiens comme "boucliers humains" afin d'empêcher les forces russes de bombarder les forces gouvernementales ukrainiennes : en d'autres termes, la Russie affirme que l'une des principales raisons des pertes civiles dans cette guerre est l'utilisation par le gouvernement ukrainien de ses propres citoyens comme otages du conflit, afin de compter sur la non-brutalité des forces russes pour protéger les forces ukrainiennes.One of the Russian Government’s main accusations against the Government of Ukraine’s President Volodmyr Zelensky is that Zelensky’s forces are using Ukraine’s civilians as “human shields” in order to prevent Russian forces from bombing Ukrainian Government forces: in other words, Russia says that a major reason for civilian casualties in this war is the Ukrainian Government’s using its own citizenry as hostages to the conflict, so as to rely upon the non-brutality of Russia’s forces in order to protect Ukraine’s own forces.https://southfront.org/cnn-unintentionally-confirms-major-russian-accusation-against-zelensky/
_source.contentraw:
CNN UNINTENTIONALLY CONFIRMS MAJOR RUSSIAN ACCUSATION AGAINST ZELENSKY.

Written by Eric Zuesse

L'une des principales accusations du gouvernement russe à l'encontre du gouvernement du président ukrainien Volodmyr Zelensky est que les forces de Zelensky utilisent les civils ukrainiens comme "boucliers humains" afin d'empêcher les forces russes de bombarder les forces gouvernementales ukrainiennes : en d'autres termes, la Russie affirme que l'une des principales raisons des pertes civiles dans cette guerre est l'utilisation par le gouvernement ukrainien de ses propres citoyens comme otages du conflit, afin de compter sur la non-brutalité des forces russes pour protéger les forces ukrainiennes.

One of the Russian Government’s main accusations against the Government of Ukraine’s President Volodmyr Zelensky is that Zelensky’s forces are using Ukraine’s civilians as “human shields” in order to prevent Russian forces from bombing Ukrainian Government forces: in other words, Russia says that a major reason for civilian casualties in this war is the Ukrainian Government’s using its own citizenry as hostages to the conflict, so as to rely upon the non-brutality of Russia’s forces in order to protect Ukraine’s own forces.
https://southfront.org/cnn-unintentionally-confirms-major-russian-accusation-against-zelensky/

_source.contentraw:
J. Alex Halderman Declaration [my notes]:

Reffensperger + Gilbert + Adida have not offered rebuttals to the issues found in Georgia's Ballot Marking Devices (BMD's)
--- • Have been non-responsive
--- • Those attempting a rebuttal against Halderman do not appear to have examined the equipment themselves
--- • Those attempting a rebuttal against Halderman have not taken actions to eliminate/fix or mitigate vulnerabilities
--- • Rebuttals against Halderman have often been vague generalities, do not address issues found, and have been at times inconsistent with election security standards or voting systems in Georgia
Analyses of equipment was done with Fulton County's DVS equipment

Severe security flaws in Georgia's BMD's:
--- • Can be exploited to install malicious software
--- --- ○ Either with temporary physical access (i.e. polling places) or remotely from election management systems [ERIC?]
--- --- ○ Can alter voters' votes while subverting all procedural protections practiced by the state which include:
--- --- --- ◘ Acceptance testing
--- --- --- ◘ Hash validation
--- --- --- ◘ Logic and accuracy testing
--- --- --- ◘ External firmware validation
--- --- --- ◘ "Risk Limiting" Audit (RLA's)
--- --- ○ Above five points are demonstrably bypassable by hacking BMD's
--- • Easier to hack Georgia's BMD's than Direct-Recording Electronic (DRE) machine
--- • BMD's can be hacked to change votes
--- --- ○ Can be hacked by individuals who go into the voting booth in minutes
--- • One route: Attackers can cheat by changing QR codes printed on BMD's
--- --- ○ Voters cannot see them but are the only part of the ballot scanners count
--- --- ○ One does not need to change both the QR code and ballot text, just the QR code
--- • BMD's can be manipulated so both barcodes and printed texts can indicate the same fraudulent selections
--- --- ○ All records of the voter's intent would then be wrong

Malware can exploit either the BMD's or scanners

Verified attack tests, like done by Logan Lamb, were undetected by current security features

The way to overcome the hacked BMD issue is to examine the actual ballots and detect where the intent on the ballot differed from what was recorded
--- • Unless every BMD ballot is voter-verified, BMD-based attacks could alter individual voters' selections without detection
--- • Voters in real-world observations tend to review their ballots less carefully than those in laboratory settings (which already have poor, ~14%, error detection rates)

Halderman & Dr. Appel's recommendation:
--- • Only provide BMD's to those that request them
--- • Use only hand-marked paper ballots by default

https://smallpdf.com/result#r=43649a733a9b535670375c06a5c47538&t=share-document

_source.contentraw:
J. Alex Halderman Declaration [my notes]:

Reffensperger + Gilbert + Adida have not offered rebuttals to the issues found in Georgia's Ballot Marking Devices (BMD's)
--- • Have been non-responsive
--- • Those attempting a rebuttal against Halderman do not appear to have examined the equipment themselves
--- • Those attempting a rebuttal against Halderman have not taken actions to eliminate/fix or mitigate vulnerabilities
--- • Rebuttals against Halderman have often been vague generalities, do not address issues found, and have been at times inconsistent with election security standards or voting systems in Georgia
Analyses of equipment was done with Fulton County's DVS equipment

Severe security flaws in Georgia's BMD's:
--- • Can be exploited to install malicious software
--- --- ○ Either with temporary physical access (i.e. polling places) or remotely from election management systems [ERIC?]
--- --- ○ Can alter voters' votes while subverting all procedural protections practiced by the state which include:
--- --- --- ◘ Acceptance testing
--- --- --- ◘ Hash validation
--- --- --- ◘ Logic and accuracy testing
--- --- --- ◘ External firmware validation
--- --- --- ◘ "Risk Limiting" Audit (RLA's)
--- --- ○ Above five points are demonstrably bypassable by hacking BMD's
--- • Easier to hack Georgia's BMD's than Direct-Recording Electronic (DRE) machine
--- • BMD's can be hacked to change votes
--- --- ○ Can be hacked by individuals who go into the voting booth in minutes
--- • One route: Attackers can cheat by changing QR codes printed on BMD's
--- --- ○ Voters cannot see them but are the only part of the ballot scanners count
--- --- ○ One does not need to change both the QR code and ballot text, just the QR code
--- • BMD's can be manipulated so both barcodes and printed texts can indicate the same fraudulent selections
--- --- ○ All records of the voter's intent would then be wrong

Malware can exploit either the BMD's or scanners

Verified attack tests, like done by Logan Lamb, were undetected by current security features

The way to overcome the hacked BMD issue is to examine the actual ballots and detect where the intent on the ballot differed from what was recorded
--- • Unless every BMD ballot is voter-verified, BMD-based attacks could alter individual voters' selections without detection
--- • Voters in real-world observations tend to review their ballots less carefully than those in laboratory settings (which already have poor, ~14%, error detection rates)

Halderman & Dr. Appel's recommendation:
--- • Only provide BMD's to those that request them
--- • Use only hand-marked paper ballots by default

https://smallpdf.com/result#r=43649a733a9b535670375c06a5c47538&t=share-document

group.description:
Thank you for joining Election Integrity. We support:

* Education and demystification of election processes
* Investigation and detection of election fraud
* Election verification through polls, especially exit polling, statistical analysis and auditing
* Direct Action to demand the bare necessities of election integrity (Please sign the petition for Elections We Can All Believe In) https://electionintegrity.org/petition-americans-united-for-election-integrity-210104.cgi
* Democracy-building through organizing, communications and events

This group is associated with the non-profit organization, "Election Integrity," founded in 2004. We have a Google group since 2006 and Facebook groups since early 2011. This Gab group was established to move these efforts to a platform *free from censorship*. But you can visit those groups for archives from our history.

Members are encouraged to post their own E.I.-related videos, photos, actions, testimonials and documents to our group page. Please keep the posts directly relevant to Election Integrity issues, and please be respectful of other group members. We are an open group, and must remain an open group if we are to continue to grow and get the word out about systematic election fraud in America.

--- • Can be exploited to install malicious software
--- --- ○ Either with temporary physical access (i.e. polling places) or remotely from election management systems [ERIC?]
--- --- ○ Can alter voters' votes while subverting all procedural protections practiced by the state which include:
--- --- --- ◘ Acceptance testing
--- --- --- ◘ Hash validation
--- --- --- ◘ Logic and accuracy testing
--- --- --- ◘ External firmware validation
--- --- --- ◘ "Risk Limiting" Audit (RLA's)
--- --- ○ Above five points are demonstrably bypassable by hacking BMD's
--- • Easier to hack Georgia's BMD's than Direct-Recording Electronic (DRE) machine
--- • BMD's can be hacked to change votes
--- --- ○ Can be hacked by individuals who go into the voting booth in minutes
--- • One route: Attackers can cheat by changing QR codes printed on BMD's
--- --- ○ Voters cannot see them but are the only part of the ballot scanners count
--- --- ○ One does not need to change both the QR code and ballot text, just the QR code
--- • BMD's can be manipulated so both barcodes and printed texts can indicate the same fraudulent selections
--- --- ○ All records of the voter's intent would then be wrong

Malware can exploit either the BMD's or scanners

Verified attack tests, like done by Logan Lamb, were undetected by current security features

The way to overcome the hacked BMD issue is to examine the actual ballots and detect where the intent on the ballot differed from what was recorded
--- • Unless every BMD ballot is voter-verified, BMD-based attacks could alter individual voters' selections without detection
--- • Voters in real-world observations tend to review their ballots less carefully than those in laboratory settings (which already have poor, ~14%, error detection rates)

Halderman & Dr. Appel's recommendation:
--- • Only provide BMD's to those that request them
--- • Use only hand-marked paper ballots by default

_source.contentraw:
https://nypost.com/2022/03/18/kevin-mccarthy-vows-to-remove-adam-schiff-from-committee/
House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy blasted Intelligence Committee Chairman Adam Schiff on Friday, vowing to remove him from the panel if the GOP takes back the majority in this year’s midterm elections after Schiff wrongly alleged The Post’s bombshell reporting on Hunter Biden’s laptop was a Russian “smear.”

“The Democrats have politicized our intelligence committee. You’ve watched it year after year since Adam Schiff has become chair,” McCarthy (R-Calif.) told reporters. “No, he doesn’t warn us about Ukraine or Afghanistan or what’s happening around the world. He tells you about politics.

“But the worst part of it is, you cannot trust what he tells you, that he lies to us,” he continued. “Just watch what has happened. Two years ago, Schiff stated the emails found from Hunter Biden were all [a] smear on Joe Biden [that] comes from the Kremlin. That’s what the head of the Intel [Committee] said.”

After The Post broke the laptop story in the fall of 2020, Schiff (D-Calif.) went on CNN and declared: “We know that this whole smear on Joe Biden comes from the Kremlin. That’s been clear for well over a year now that they’ve been pushing this false narrative about the vice president and his son.”
“Clearly, the origins of this whole smear are from the Kremlin, and the president [Donald Trump] is only too happy to have Kremlin help and try to amplify it.” Schiff doubled down in the same interview.

However, then-Director of National Intelligence John Ratcliffe disputed Schiff’s claim at the time, and his assessment was backed by the Department of Justice.

This week, the New York Times confirmed the existence of the laptop — 17 whole months after The Post first reported on it.

SEE ALSO
Hunter Biden comp
GOP fury at Big Tech, Dems after NYT admits Hunter Biden laptop is real
“Adam Schiff lied to us one more time,” the minority leader said Friday. “Why is he still chair of the committee? And why is he even on the committee? In a new Congress, if it’s a new majority, he will not be.

“You cannot make this committee political,” McCarthy went on. “You cannot use it as a position of a chairman to lie, and you should be focused on what the American people want you to be focused on around the world.”

The hard drive of the laptop contained a trove of emails, text messages, photos and financial documents related to Hunter Biden, his family and business associates — detailing how the president’s son used his name and relatives as leverage in his overseas business dealings.

A Delaware computer repair shop owner reported the laptop to the FBI, which seized the device and its hard drive.

McCarthy previously called for Schiff’s ouster from the Intel Committee earlier this year, while vowing to also remove Rep. Eric Swalwell (D-Calif.) over his reported links to a Chinese intelligence agent.
